short_description: This function computes the likelihood ratio test for two models on the same input data.
long_description: This function computes the likelihood ratio test for two models on the same input data.

input_tables.name: model1
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the first model to compare.
input_tables.description: The table containing the first model to compare.

input_tables.name: model2
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the second model to compare.
input_tables.description: The table containing the second model to compare.

argument_clauses.name: Statistic
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the name of the statistic. This column	corresponds to the ta.glm output column 'predictor'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the name of the statistic. This column	corresponds to the GLM output column 'predictor'.

argument_clauses.name: LogLik
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the log-likelihood of the ta.glm model. This column corresponds to the ta.glm output column 'estimate'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the log-likelihood of the GLM model. This column corresponds to the GLM output column 'estimate'.

argument_clauses.name: ObsNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the number of observations. This column corresponds to the ta.glm output column 'std_err'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the number of observations. This column corresponds to the GLM output column 'std_err'.

argument_clauses.name: ParamNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the number of parameters (excluding the intercept). This column corresponds to the ta.glm output column 'z_score'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the number of parameters (excluding the intercept). This column corresponds to the GLM output column 'z_score'.
